definition: to look after
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: The guard guards the guarantee in the garden regardless of the hazard.
sentences.chinese: 衛卒不顧風險看管着花園裏的典質品。

sentences.english: He took with him several of his subordinates, and amongst them Dantès' jailer.
sentences.chinese: 他帶走了幾個下屬，看管唐太斯的獄卒也在其中。

sentences.english: The accident happened at that unattended crossroads.
sentences.chinese: 事故發生在那個無人看管的平交道。

sentences.english: Then she left the cow to the care of a hundred eyed monster, Argus.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉便將牛犢託付給百眼魔鬼阿剛斯看管。

sentences.english: He used to oversee my place on the lake, and did it capitally, too.
sentences.chinese: 他替我看管湖邊那所別墅，管理得非常出色。

sentences.english: Mom needs support! An impulsive three-year-old who needs constant supervision is taxing.
sentences.chinese: 需要一直看管着一個易衝動的三歲小孩是很費力的。

sentences.english: All the items are not allowed to carry, the invigilator is not responsible for the care of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 所有不準攜帶的物品，監考教師不負責看管。

sentences.english: Jane is charge of the office while Mr. Smith is away.
sentences.chinese: 當史密斯先生不在時，珍看管辦公室。

sentences.english: He will be the caretaker of the snowbound Overlook Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 他將成爲冰封的“眺望旅館”的看管員。

sentences.english: She wished me to look after the house, to see callers, and answer notes of condolence.
sentences.chinese: 她希望我替她看管房子，接待來客，回覆唁函。

sentences.english: I’ll have to keep a close eye on Chiellini, especially at set-pieces.
sentences.chinese: 我必須好好看管基耶利尼，尤其是定位球上。

sentences.english: He must look after his bag.
sentences.chinese: 他必須看管好自己的書包。

sentences.english: Monitor compliance with the corporate code of conduct/business practices.
sentences.chinese: 看管公司對行爲規範和商業通例的遵循水平。

sentences.english: Thus, they need to be closely supervised.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他們需要得到密切看管。

sentences.english: When the warden took charge, the prison had fewer than 100 inmates.
sentences.chinese: 在典獄官看管時，監獄中有不到100個獄友。

definition: to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to guard/to watch over
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
to look after/to provide for
sternly/strictly/harshly/stringently/rigorously
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
to tend/to take care of sb
to imprison/to lock up (in jail)
to tell/to exhort/injunction
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
variant of 交代[jiao1 dai4]
to interrogate/to examine/to question
